revised_title: The Relationship between Nervous and Muscular Systems in Animals
tldr: The author examines the relationship between the nervous and muscular systems in animals, focusing on how the nervous system influences the muscles of voluntary and involuntary motion. They argue that the brain and spinal cord are the active parts of the nervous system, while nerves serve as conduits for the influence of these organs. The author also discusses the role of ganglionic nerves and their ganglia in the formation of nervous influence.
